title: Business Breakfast LIVE: Hargreaves Services trading update and corporation tax set to be cut
text:
8.02 Coreena Ford Hargreaves Trading update - potential Brexit boost 
County Durham’s Hargreaves Service has issued a post-close trading update - the only North East firm to issue any stock announcements so far today. 
The firm - the UK’s leading supplier of solid fuel and bulk material logistics – says trading in the run up to the year end was in line with management expectations. 
Last year the firm set in motion a redundancy and cost-saving programme after what it described as the “most challenging” times ever seen in its sector. 
Now directors say the restructuring and repositioning of the Group’s core operations continues to progress and the resulting restructuring and exceptional costs are expected to be broadly in line with previous market guidance. 
Impacts of Brexit are being analysed, and Hargreaves could stand to benefit because of dollar-denominated coke and coal. 8.00 Coreena Ford Good morning . . .
